Hello Pankaj,

Thank you for contacting Netwrix Support support.

Before we can proceed further with the case, can you please provide us the following information:
•        What is the name of the customer?
•        What are the steps to reproduce?
•        Have you attempted any troubleshooting steps yet? If so, what have you tried?

We will also recommend that customer upgrade their Endpoint Protector Server to version 5.9.4.2 and the EPP client to version 6.2.4.2000.  Kindly provide us with the required details above.


Kind regards

ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0O4Bf1:ref
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #442061 -  - Websites is not now opening    [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0O4Bf1:ref ]

TextBody:
Hi Pankaj,

Thank you for your time in our remote session today.  

Today in our remote session we discovered that Deep Packet Inspection was turned on but Stealthy DPI Driver was not turned on, which caused some web pages not to load on the affected endpoint machine.
After we have enabled "Stealthy DPI Driver" for the affected endpoint machine under "Device Control" > "Computers" > "Manage Settings" > "DPI Configuration" , the web browsing resumed as expected.

Stealthy DPI Driver is a feature that enhances Deep Packet Inspection functionality, especially if you have 3rd party software installed like antivirus, VPN and other cybersecurity software.  It enabled Endpoint Protector to work alongside other applications by eliminating interference between applications.



To enable "Stealthy DPI Driver" on a global level, you can find the same settings under under "Device Control" > "Global Settings" > "Manage Settings" > "DPI Configuration".  This will enable Stealthy DPI driver for all computers that are inheriting their settings from the Global Level.

Kindly confirm if we may proceed to close this case.


Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com

This Email may contain confidential information. Not to be disclosed to third parties without prior written approval.

From: Netwrix Support <techsupport@netwrix.com>
Sent: 15 April 2025 23:18
To: Pankaj Kumar Pandit <pankaj@cyberspace.in>
Cc: Sumit kaushik <sumit@cloudmailstore.com>; Neha Verma <nehav@cloudmailstore.com>
Subject: Re: Netwrix Support Ticket #442061 - - Websites is not now opening [ ref:!00D70091pB.!500Qk0O4Bf1:ref ]

 


Hi Pankaj,

Thank you for your time in our remote session today.  

Today in our remote session we discovered that Deep Packet Inspection was turned on but Stealthy DPI Driver was not turned on, which caused some web pages not to load on the affected endpoint machine.
After we have enabled "Stealthy DPI Driver" for the affected endpoint machine under "Device Control" > "Computers" > "Manage Settings" > "DPI Configuration" , the web browsing resumed as expected.

Stealthy DPI Driver is a feature that enhances Deep Packet Inspection functionality, especially if you have 3rd party software installed like antivirus, VPN and other cybersecurity software.  It enabled Endpoint Protector to work alongside other applications by eliminating interference between applications.



To enable "Stealthy DPI Driver" on a global level, you can find the same settings under under "Device Control" > "Global Settings" > "Manage Settings" > "DPI Configuration".  This will enable Stealthy DPI driver for all computers that are inheriting their settings from the Global Level.

Kindly confirm if we may proceed to close this case.


Kind regards
__________________
André Le Roux | Technical Support Engineer
Endpoint Protector by CoSoSys, now part of Netwrix
DLP | Device Control | Content Aware Protection | eDiscovery | Enforced Encryption
www.endpointprotector.com
